channel.title: Delaying Modular Input signals by small amounts
channel.description:
Hi there I'm checking if something is possible with Axoloti before investing into buying one. I need to introduce phasing into a modular input signal (a simpe VCO for example) and produce two slightly delayed mono output signals.
1 I want to know if it's possible. 2 If it's possible to detect the input frequency to calculate the amount of delay as a fraction of pi. 3 What's the maximum voltage input/output reachable.
Thanks a lot for your time.
A

item.title: Delaying Modular Input signals by small amounts
item.dc:creator: @Ott
item.description:
@Ott wrote:

I can't answer for all these questions as I've just received mine, but Axoloti has a maximum input/output of 3.3V (as the whole board runs on 5V), so you'll need to adjust your amplitudes. Check out the "euxoloti" project for Eurorack interfacing.

Read full topic
item.source: Delaying Modular Input signals by small amounts
